title: Yasuo is the reason ADCs can't have nice things
body:
Like crit ADCs have been sucking for a long time. Why? Because every time crit items become viable for ADCs, they become broken on Yasuo. Once again the second crit items get buffed yasuo spikes in win rate and will probably become busted again soon. 

The problem with crit items is that until you get IE + zeal item, your items are pretty much worthless. Also you probably need another crit item if you wanna start dealing damage. However as we all know Yasuo spikes hard with just PD because of his passive, and spikes EVEN harder with IE. Crit items have to be garbage early/mid because otherwise Yasuo becomes a monster way too quick. 

ADCs have pretty much been forced to build lethality/BoRK because those are items that aren't balanced around a fking DOUBLE CRIT PASSIVE. Like yeah you can be relevant early/mid game with crit items IF YOU GET DOUBLE CRIT, but ADCs don't and HAVE TO find a way to be relevant in another way. 

All I'm saying is this: Don't balance crit items around yasuo and instead balance yasuo around his crit passive (because they're obviously not gonna change that). Like if crit items make him broken? NERF HIM don't go after the items that will finally make crit ADCs viable again.

Absolutely. One of the predominant requests since Season 1 was to have a viable, auto-attacking melee carry. We have melee-carry style champs like Tryndamere and Master Yi but they're often garbage and don't work well.

Most melee carries in League are a mix between auto-attacking and spell casting: {{champion:41}} {{champion:114}} {{champion:157}} (And I specifically mean champs who can put entire teams in their backpacks. Not so much Darius or Morde who get murked ez pz)

An AA-centric melee carry is going to be crap, overbearing, or incredibly obnoxious even if they're balanced in League. Tryn and Yi both show evidence of all three at various points in League's history. I get the feeling that trying to introduce an AA-centric melee carry isn't going to result in anything but those three traits, due to how League is balanced and what people in League (or at least on the boards) are willing to deal with.

Because it's very hard to get those two kills early and Yi requires a ton of items to scale to the point of carrying a game. Yi also struggles in every lane save jungle. AKA The one lane where gold income isn't very high to justify the items he needs.

Conversely, Yasuo spikes at 100% crit/two items and can itemize far more defensively after that. He also works well top/mid because of his kit and has the ability to work well in those lanes, further making his itemization easier to achieve.

So sure, Yi might be viable at some level, but he's far and away a terrible melee carry the moment you know how to deal with him. Which is usually gold-and-above.
Yi just has to gank the lane with hard cc and just farm for a while. A fed yi is far scarier than a fed yasuo.

Most of the game is actually balanced around its interaction with the ADC class.

Tanks and juggernauts are balanced based on how well they can tank and fight an ADC.
Assassins are based on how well they can kill an ADC (arguably mages too, but mages are not binary).
Supports are... well, this one is obvious.
Mages are balanced based on how well they perform compared to an ADC.
Turrets are balanced based on bot lane.
Games are freaking based off of bot lane's success.

It's ridiculous.

Critical and AS items haven't been "buffed" and lifesteal hasn't been "buffed" (+5% on BorK a few patches ago).

ADCs will be no stronger late game than they were (full build is the same, you reach is 200 gold earlier but at that point in the game its irrelevant). They just hit spikes earlier. The problem is 2 item spike for ADC is nice whereas its end of your life with yasuo. That's the difference.

Crit builds are *supposed* to take until late-mid to late game to be effective because, newsflash, they do a TON of damage.
